sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 24 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C24, the alternating group A5, or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24.
message_1: What is the number of non-isomorphic groups of order 24, and what are these groups?
message_2:
There are 15 non-isomorphic groups of order 24. These groups are:

1. Z_24 (cyclic group)
2. Z_2 x Z_2 x Z_2 x Z_3 (direct product of cyclic groups)
3. Z_2 x Z_4 x Z_3 (direct product of cyclic groups)
4. Z_6 x Z_4 (direct product of cyclic groups)
5. Z_12 x Z_2 (direct product of cyclic groups)
6. Z_2 x S_3 (semi-direct product)
7. Z_2 x D_12 (semi-direct product)
8. Z_3 x S_3 (semi-direct product)
9. Z_3 x D_8 (semi-direct product)
10. Z_4 x S_3 (semi-direct product)
11. Z_4 x D_6 (semi-direct product)
12. Z_6 x D_4 (semi-direct product)
13. Q_24 (generalized quaternion group)
14. SL(2, Z_3) (special linear group)
15. A_4 x Z_2 (direct product of alternating group and cyclic group)

These groups can be found using the Sylow theorems and considering the possible structures of groups of order 24, which is 2^3 * 3.
